ratings.comment: Mark is a really nice guy, but he has absolutely ZERO organizational skills. He does a terrible job of explaining assignments and kept pushing our investigative report off; currently getting hammered by all of that. He rambles on and on about stories to lighten the mood in a completely useless class. Not an awful prof to get, but an awful course.

Nice guy, but horrible class. Not very organized. Would give different instructions on assignments and change expectations. Talks so slow and rambles on irrelevant stories. Overall, pretty easy grader compared to other GB300 professors but very frustrating.

This class is very easy and straightforward; however, if you take it with Lindquist, you will be added unneeded work and pain. Lindquist is a great person but a terrible professor. He spends most of class telling stories which leaves no time to take in relevant info. He is also EXTREMELY unorganized. He will send some assignments out on canvas and
Great professor; beyond great. If I had to take this class again, I would definitely take it with him.

Mark is a very chill and relaxed professor. This is good for some, but people who like a lot of structure and organization to their classes might not like him. Otherwise, he is a really easy grader and genuinely enjoys listening to students.
Mark is the best professor I have had so far. Such an overall good dude. He grades fairly, and tells great stories.

Mark is a great guy and great teacher. I learned a lot from him and will use this knowledge for the rest of my life. He tells great stories. Only downside of taking this class with him is that he won't get to grade your final portfolio (because all the teachers swap). And wasted money on textbook that is used once. Easy class. Would recommend.
The class now focus on a single portfolio with 3 speeches rather than the group work. There would be periods of time with nothing due and then many weeks of big reports due.

This class is a breeze but incredibly boring-- the first half of the semester you pretty much learn how to write an email. There's also a really long group project but it's doable. The work load is really sporadic- you'll go weeks with no assignments or projects but then you'll have a presentation due every week for a month. Very disorganized

He is awesome. He is very understanding and truly wants everyone to do well in the class. Yes, he doesn't need to take the whole class period to teach us, but he really likes to get to know his students. Pay attention to what he says in class, that will be the only information you really need to know. Also, he did use the textbook for homework.

He is a good professor. I took this class in summer, and it is a three week class. It was intense was definitely something you can manage. He is not a hard grader. I would recommend taking in the summer.
Best professor for ProComm! The two required books are absolutely unnecessary--nothing was ever assigned from them!

Prof. Lindquist is a fun guy to be around, and his random stories make for a nice interruption to the somewhat dull material at times. Overall this class is pretty straight-forward as are his expectations. Do the work and you should have no problem getting a good grade.
I enjoyed this class and professor. The subject matter at times felt unnecessary. Lindquist is approachable and laid back. He enjoys teaching and it is evident.

I was not a fan of this prof. The class was easy and the information could be absorbed within 20 minutes (not 75). He filled the rest of the time with ramblings about his life which felt like a complete waste of my life.

Lindquist is the man! Great professor for ProComm; doesn't take himself or the class too seriously. Clear expectations for assignments and grading. If you do all the work, you should have no problem getting an A. Very funny guy, and easy to get along with. I definitely recommend taking ProComm with Lindquist.

Lindquist is super-cool and not difficult. He only allows two missed classes, however. Second half of the semester is all presentations so that was not very fun. Expect to spend a lot of time with your group.
Very good professor. Easy class if you do all the work. Not to time consuming. Take Pro Comm  with him!
